isis.stitle: 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14613 - REASSEMBLE - COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES

note.para: Except for the PTO gears, the left and right countershaft assemblies are identical and reassembled in the same manner.
Reverse, low, 1st and 2nd speed gears are part of the shaft and are not serviceable.

step1.para: Press the 3rd speed gear on the countershaft, long hub of the gear to the front of the countershaft ( Figure 201).

figure.caption: Figure 201. Press 3rd Speed Gear on Countershaft

step1.para: Start the PTO gear onto the countershaft, bullet-nose side of teeth facing up and toward the rear of the shaft ( Figure 202). Align the keyway of the drive gear with the key in the countershaft and press BOTH gears onto the shaft, long hub of the drive gear against the PTO gear.

figure.caption: Figure 202. Start PTO Gear onto Countershaft

note.para: The left countershaft assembly has a 47-tooth PTO gear; the right countershaft assembly has a 45-tooth PTO gear.

figure.caption: Figure 203. Mark End of Left Countershaft With "L" and Right With "R"

step1.para: Install the drive gear retaining snap ring in the groove on the front of each countershaft ( Figure 204).

figure.caption: Figure 204. Install Drive Gear Retaining Snap Ring

step1.para: Use a flanged-end driver to install the bearing inner race on the shaft, shoulder of race against the shoulder of the countershaft ( Figure 205)
